isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Mounting Engine on Stand - Mounting Engine

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

regulation.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to applicable regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.
Dispose of fuel according to applicable regulations in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL.

note.para: Before mounting engine on engine stand, complete steps 1 through 6.

step1.para: Remove two coolant drain plugs and drain coolant from crankcase into a suitable container. Coolant drain plugs are in rear of crankcase, below exhaust manifolds.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, dispose of oil or discard components, according to applicable regulations.

step1.para: Remove oil pan drain plug and drain oil into a suitable container.

note.para: Lubricate oil pan drain plug O-ring with clean engine oil.

step1.para: After fluids are drained from engine, reinstall plugs.
Tighten oil pan drain plug to special torque .

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine is supported before removing mounting hardware.

To prevent personal injury or death, use a chain hoist rated for the weight of the engine, follow manufacturer's installation and safety instructions, and attach safety latch lifting hooks to lifting eyes on the engine.

step1.para: Attach hoist hook lifting bracket to engine lifting eyes. Use safety catches on hoist hooks when lifting engine.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use only grade 8 or class 10.9 bolts to secure engine stand mounting bracket to engine and engine lift stand.

note.para: See manufacturer's safety instructions (included with engine lift stand and engine stand mounting bracket).

figure.caption: Mounting bolts for engine stand mounting bracket

calloutgroup.callout1: M10 x 30 class 10.9 mounting bolts (4) to engine block
Grade 8 or class 10.9 mounting bolts (4) to engine lift stand

step1.para:
Position engine stand mounting bracket ZTSE4507
on right side of engine. Secure bracket plate with four M10 x 30 class 10.9 mounting bolts and washers. Tighten bolts to standard torque .
Mount engine on engine lift stand using four grade 8 or class 10.9 mounting bolts.
